TopicTitle: PYLON SSTO: a 0.23 replica of REL's Skylon!

Articles.Content:
ZodiaK ind. presents...

the PYLON SSTO

Are you a budding kerbal space entrepreneur?

Are you tired of using expensive, wasteful, unweildly rockets to boost your probes into orbit?

There's GOT to be a better way!

Well now there is! with the new

PYLON SSTO!

This revolutionary spaceplane allows you to launch your satellites into space for less than half of the price of conventional rockets! -what a save!

We have harnessed the groundbreaking technology of new RAPIER engines to build this sleek, stylish, super-charged Skylon Substitute!

Can you afford not to fly this beautiful addition to any fleet?

Javascript is disabled. View full album

FLIGHT GUIDE:

// action groups: 1 will open / close cargo bay legs. Gear only opens / closes landing gear.

(On load, the PYLON SSTO might fall apart slightly. to fix, revert to launch until nothing falls off. simple!)

1. Throttle to 100% and taxi down runway until at end. once you have fallen off of the runway, pitch IMMEDIATELY to 45o.

2. Keep flying at 100% throttle at 45 degrees until you reach roughly 10 kilometers. at this point, plateau a bit, making prograde at about 20o.

3. Keep flying at this angle until rocket mode kicks in. throttle down to 45% throttle and point at 45o.

Oxidizer is very limited, so be careful!

4. Boost until AP marker reaches 80 kilometres.

5. Once at AP, boost until PE marker is above 70 kilometres. adjust orbit accordingly.

6. press 1 to open the cargo bay. undock your craft and separate it from PYLON.

RE-ENTRY PHASE

1. burn retrograde wherever. we don't care.

2. once in atmosphere, keep the pylon in line with your prograde indicator, pitched at about 20o above the horizon.

3. From here, you can either glide to land (unlikely) or fly under power to land or runway.

4. upon landing, you can brake immediately if you want. again, we don't care.

I, for one, find that it's not the easiest thing to fly (It would probably work better with a joystick!), but the practicability and novelty of this craft more than makes it up (or at least, that's what I hope). Please note that I am no mulbin, and cannot work to his/her standards, but I give all of my crafts my best work. whether it be extensive research or design work (I had to go through several internal iterations to get it to where it is now), or perhaps large amounts of time spent on the drawing board. I hope that the PYLON presents itself ,at first, as a challenge, before becoming a friend, and finally, an unforgettable asset. know that this is not the definite model, but more the start of a new era in cargo spaceplanes. As 0.23 has been granted to us players, as have the players been granted less restriction in the realm of commercial competition and creativity. the PYLON could be seen as the figurehead craft of ZodiaK industries, leading us into the unknown and untested. I would like to finish my letter by saying that as the winter season falls cold on our heads, that ZodiaK industries does not take responsebility for nuclear fallout being mis-identified as snow. Merry Kerbmish!
